title: Electric flux - find b given flux for square

content.question: If the electric flux through the square is <math alttext="3.0 newton meters squared per coulomb" overflow="scroll"> <mn>3.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi> <mo>·</mo> <msup> <mtext>m</mtext> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> <mtext>/C</mtext> </math>, what is the value of the constant <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 newtons per coulomb meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/</mtext><mpadded><mtext>(C</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m)</mtext></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="12 newtons per coulomb meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/</mtext><mpadded><mtext>(C</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m)</mtext></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="24 newtons per coulomb meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/</mtext><mpadded><mtext>(C</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m)</mtext></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="48 newtons per coulomb meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/</mtext><mpadded><mtext>(C</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m)</mtext></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="48 newtons per coulomb meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/</mtext><mpadded><mtext>(C</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m)</mtext></mpadded></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
